H0.text: The average temperature yesterday was 15 °C is a statement about climate.

H1.text: The temperature range today was 10°C to 20°C, a statement about climate.

H2.text: The high temperature tomorrow will be 14°C is a statement about climate.

H3.text: The average high temperature in May is 20 °C, which is a statement about climate.

A4.text: Climate is the long-term weather pattern in a region, typically averaged over 30 years.

A5.text: A climate normal is defined as the arithmetic average of a climate element over a 30-year period.

A6.text: Climate is what you expect, weather is what you get.

A7.text: Climate is the mean and variability of meteorological variables over a time spanning from months to millions of years.

A8.text: Global scale meteorology pushes into the range of climatology.

A9.text: Meteorology is the scientific study of the Earth's atmosphere and short-term atmospheric phenomena (i.e., weather), with a focus on weather forecasting.
